title: Excellently Sacrificed Piece | Wesley So vs Praggnanandhaa | Leon Masters (2018)
description:
#agadmator Follow my Instagram https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Watch Nezhmetdinov vs Chernikov here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G90SVhxKeig

If you don't have time to watch the entire video, watch it here http://www.chessgames.com/perl/chessgame?gid=1260278

It was one of Praggnanandhaa's biggest tests after becoming a GM. He was invited to the Leon Masters 2018 to fight it out in the four game rapid match against Wesley So. Many people thought that it would be a complete rout. But the 12-year-old surprised one and all by his inspired play. He beat Wesley So in game one and after three games the score was tied at 1.5-1.5. In the last game So showed his superior understanding and advanced to the finals. Praggnanandhaa lost the match, but won many hearts.

Read more here https://chessbase.in/news/Praggnanandhaa_Wesley_So_Leon_2018

Wesley So vs Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa
Leon Masters (2018), Leon ESP, rd 1, Jul-07 
Indian Game: General (A45)

1. d4 Nf6 2. Bf4 d5 3. Nc3 Bf5 4. Nb5 Na6 5. e3 e6 6. c4 c6 7. Nc3 Nb4 8. Rc1 Qa5 9. Qd2 dc4 10. Bc4 Nbd5 11. Be5 Nc3 12. Bf6 gf6 13. bc3 Rg8 14. g3 Ba3 15. Rd1 Rd8 16. f3 b5 17. Bd3 b4 18. Bf5 bc3 19. Qc2 Rb8 20. Be4 Rb2 21. Bc6 Ke7 22. Qa4 Qa4 23. Ba4 c2 24. Bc2 Rc2 25. Nh3 Bb4 26. Kf1 Rgc8 27. Rg1 Rh2 28. Nf2 Rc2 29. Rg2 Rg2 30. Kg2 Bd2 31. Kh3 Be3 32. Ng4 Bc1 33. d5 ed5 34. Rd5 Ra2 35. Rc5 h5 36. Rh5 Bb2 37. Rc5 Bd4 38. Rc4 Rd2 39. Nh6 Ke6 40. Kg4 Kd5 41. Ra4 Be3 42. f4 Bb6 43. Kf5 Rd3 44. g4 Rd4 45. Ra6 Bc7 46. Kf6 Rf4 47. Kg7 Bb6 48. g5 Ke6 49. Ra2 Rf3 50. Re2 Re3 51. Rg2 Rf3 52. Re2 Re3 53. Rg2 Rf3
